text.0: bards of approaching dawn who know the heavens are come with hymns to throw the mountain open.
text.1: the sun hath risen and oped the stable portals the doors of men too hath the god thrown open.
text.2: sūrya hath spread his light as splendour hither came the cows mother conscious from the stable.
text.3: to streams that flow with biting waves to deserts and heaven is stablished like a firmset pillar.
text.4: this laud hath won the burden of the mountain to aid the ancient birth of mighty waters.
text.5: the mountain parted heaven performed his office the worshippers were worn with constant serving.
text.6: with hymns and godloved words will i invoke you indra and agni to obtain your favour.
text.7: for verily sages skilled in sacrificing worship the maruts and with lauds invite them.
text.8: this day approach us may our thoughts be holy far from us let us cast away misfortune.
text.9: let us keep those who hate us at a distance and haste to meet the man who sacrifices.
text.10: come let us carry out o friends the purpose wherewith the mother threw the cows stall open.
text.11: that wherewith manu conquered visisipra wherewith the wandering merchant gained heavens water.
text.12: here urged by hands loudly hath rung the pressstone wherewith navagvas through ten months sang praises.
text.13: saramā went aright and found the cattle aṅgiras gave effect to all their labours.
text.14: when at the dawning of this mighty goddess aṅgirases all sang forth with the cattle.
text.15: their spring is in the loftiest place of meetingsaramā found the kine by orders pathway.
text.16: borne by his coursers seven may sūrya visit the field that spreadeth wide for his long journey.
text.17: down on the soma swooped the rapid falcon bright was the young sage moving mid his cattle.
text.18: sūrya hath mounted to the shining ocean when he hath yoked his fairbacked tawny horses.
text.19: the wise have drawn him like a ship through water the floods obedient have descended hither.
text.20: i lay upon the floods your hymn lightwinning wherewith navagvas their ten months completed.
text.21: through this our hymn may we have gods to guard us through this our hymn pass safe beyond affliction.
